name: ID MicroAlgae
body:
# Abstract Visual identification of microorganism requires a lot of experience and expertise from a person, who performs identification / recognition, but still canâ€™t guarantee high level of accuracy. Modern high precision approaches (like DNA / special sites sequencing) are expensive and time consuming.

This project has been designed to be an express tool for visual identification of microalgae cells on picture taken by microscope camera. *** # Problem description ### Given: Picture of microalgae, made with microscope camera and contained several cells. ### Find: - Belonging to specie / genera
- Probability of correct identification, measured in %

Approach / Tool:

Pre-trained Neural Network (NN) ***

Possibilities

Right now project is trained to identify following genera (without identifying specie name):
  • Achnanthidium
  • Aulacoseira
  • Chlorella
  • Craticula
  • Cymbella
  • Cymbopleura
  • Desmodesmus
  • Encyonema
  • Encyonopsis
  • Eunotia
  • Fragilaria
  • Frustulia
  • Gomphonema
  • Navicula
  • Nitzschia
  • Nupela
  • Pinnularia
  • Planothidium
  • Psammothidium
  • Sellaphora
  • Stauroneis
  • Surirella

Tolal : 22 genera ***

Further work

  • Add identification of multiple objects per photo
  • Add highlighting and counting of identified objects
  • Add creating of reports / Sending it via e-mail
  • Improve recognition accuracy and variety of objects for recognition
  • Add various recognition algorithms for pictures made with varied microscopes and magnifications
***

Testing

Current testing version is deployed on `c9.io`:
https://id-microalgae-pererva.c9users.io/ *** # Deploying and requirements Project has been tested on Windows 7 ... 10 (64-bit only) and Ubuntu 14.04 ... 16.04 (64-bit only) with Python 3.5. ### Deploying on Windows: Install Python 3.5.2 (other versions were not tested) https://www.python.org/downloads/release/python-352/ Create the folder for your project (let say D:\MicroAlgae_ID) Open it in explorer and run the command line from current location (click the right mouse button in explorer windows with pressed Shift-key and choose the Run Command Line here from pop-up menu). Install the virtualenv for python (you can install other packages in system python, but it has conflicts in Windows 8-10, so using of virtual environments is strongly recommended) by running:
`pip install virtualenv`
Create the virtual environment:
`virtualenv -p python3 .\`
Enter the created environment:
`.\env\Scripts\activate.bat`
Install other required packages:
`pip install Django TensorFlow Pillow`
Copy the `src` and `tf` folders to your project folder (D:/MicroAlgae_ID) and type in opened command line:
`python .\src\manage.py runserver`
To create the one-click start for project create a `run.cmd` file in project folder with following content:
`call .\env\Scripts\activate.bat`
`python .\src\manage.py runserver` ### Deploying on Ubuntu: Open the terminal and create the project folder (let say ~/ID_MicroAlgae):
`mkdir ~\ID_MicroAlgae`
Install the virtualenv, create the environment and activate it:
`pip install virtualenv`
`virtuaenv -p \usr\bin\python3 ~\ID_MicroAlgae\env`
`source ~\ID_MicroAlgae\env\bin\activate`
Install all requirements:
`pip install pillow django tensorflow`
Copy the `src` and `tf` folders to your project folder (~/ID_MicroAlgae) and type in opened command line:
`python ~\ID_MicroAlgae\src\manage.py runserver`
Now You should have an access to project via browser by entering the address
`127.0.0.1:8080`

Sometimes (if you are deploying on some public free domains like `c9.oi` ) you could need to modify this command to something like (Please, check the documentation ):
`python ~\ID_MicroAlgae\src\manage.py runserver $IP:$PORT`

To create the one-click start for project create the run.sh file in convenient for you location with following content:
`source ~\ID_MicroAlgae\env\bin\activate && python ~\ID_MicroAlgae\src\manage.py runserver`
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
